results.description:
Bump! Set! Spike! 

Join us for pick-up games of sand volleyball located on the 4 sand courts at Highland Park, right behind the pool. The courts are first come, first serve and they have no out of bounds lines (no bathroom access yet either!). We'll have to bring a set lines or draw them in the sand.


Recreational play, so all skill levels are welcome.  While we encourage you to have knowledge of the basics (bump, set, spike), most importantly, we're here to have fun!
results.name: Recreational Pick-Up Volleyball (All Levels)

venue.address_1: Carnegie library of Pittsburgh - Squirrel Hill Branch
venue.name: Room A, Carnegie library of Pittsburgh, Squirrel Hill

results.description:
We are delighted to be supporting an event Saturday April 30th at the Squirrel Hill Library rooms A & B, when Cuban professor Felipe de Jesus Perez Cruz, specialist in Latin American Studies, will be speaking on Cuba and its many connections to Africa, and how the Cuban Revolution is dealing with racism in Cuba.

This will be an opportunity for an in-depth discussion on how a revolutionary society is trying to change deeply embedded social prejudices that sabotage the goals of the revolution in creating a society that brings equal opportunity and value to all.

We encourage you to attend this important encounter, because what makes Cuba 'special' is the commitment of the revolution to make a better world.
results.name: Cuba - AFRICA & ANGOLA!

venue.name: Unitarian Universalist Church of North Hills

results.description:
DRUM CIRCLE, DANCING\Music Jam at Grove of Gaia Spring Festival Sat. April 30th 1pm on...

Weather permitting, there will be a Drum Circle at Grove of Gaia Fest OUTSIDE by the beautiful pergola area outside at 1 PM.

Bring your drums other musical instruments WELCOME!

PLAY! Dance, Sing, Clap and ENJOY!

All attendees including drummers must check in at the Admissions Table to pay $5 entry and get their wristband for the day's events.

RAIN LOCATION for Drum Circle: the Room near the Admissions Table.

Bring Drums or other musical instruments to jam, DANCE, SING have FUN!

****

10th Annual Grove of Gaia, Spring Festival

FB EVENT PAGE:http://www.facebook.com/events/690810424352961/

Where: Universal Unitarian Church of the NORTH HILLS (Franklin Park)

2359 W Ingomar Rd Pittsburgh PA 15237

Old style festival celebrating the Celtic, Pagan, Wiccan, Druid celebration of Beltane, the Festival of Spring. It's the 10th year, lots of fun, kid & adult friendly.

*MAYPOLE Celebration (11am to participate)

*DRUM CIRCLE 1pm if it rains, there is a indoor drum circle

*Vendors

*Psychics

*Massage

*Healers

*GREAT FOOD!  Funnel Cakes! Gyros, VEGAN & VEGETARIAN MENU! MAC N CHEESE!  The Vegan Goddess is also Vending!
results.how_to_find_us: Either Outside where the Pergola is is in the Back OR inside if it is raining...
results.name: Drum Circle N Music Jam at Grove of Gaia Spring Festival

Turn into the Upper St. Clair Rec Center and go to the left.  Go to the top of the hill and turn left again into the parking lot and drive straight back towards the pavilion that will also be on the left.    There is plenty of parking.

Do not go to the Rec Center... go to the pavilion.  My phone number is[masked]

We will be gone for about 1-1/2 hours.  This is the other side of Boyce Mayview park that we have been walking on if you have been on other Meetups.

venue.name: Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh - East Liberty Branch

results.description:
Liberation leads to liberation...by liberation is meant the liberation which is the aim of all schools, all religions, at all times.  This liberation can indeed be very great.  All men desire it and strive after it.  But it cannot be attained without the first liberation, a lesser liberation.  The great liberation is liberation from influences outside us.  The lesser liberation is liberation from influences within us.  

... The full reading for this topic can be found in Views from the Real World: Early Talks of G.I. Gurdjieff  (last chapter)
results.name: The Search for Inner Freedom

results.description:
Let us come together to build a community of meditators and spread the benefits of meditation among Pittsburghers. So come and join with us in a Joyful meditation for health and happiness and tell the whole city "I Meditate Pittsburgh." :-)

There are no prerequisites and all above 12 yrs of age are welcome to join. Consider telling your friends and bring them along.

Event will be simple. We will start with some introduction to meditation, do some gentle stretches and have a guided meditation with the group. At the end we will share our experiences and open floor for questions and discussions. You can also ask any questions you may have in the beginning or email us now.

Please RSVP for the event and we look forward to seeing you.
results.name: Meditation for Health and Happiness

results.description:
Avril et le monde truqué
Fri, Apr 29 to Thu, May 5
Regent Square Theater From the producers of “Persepolis” and graphic novelist Jacques Tardi, comes this riveting sci-fi adventure set in an alternate steampunk universe. A family of French scientists is on the brink of discovering a longevity serum when they are abducted, leaving their young daughter behind. Ten years later, April (voiced by Marion Cotillard) lives with her cat, Darwin, and carries on her family’s research in secret. But she soon finds herself in peril. Undaunted, she continues her quest to discover the truth behind her parents’ disappearance. The English language version features Paul Giamatti, Susan Sarandon and J.K. Simmons. NOTE: English-dubbed version at afternoon screenings; French language with subtitles, evenings.

Christian Desires, Franck Ekinci | 2015 | France | 103 min
http://cinema.pfpca.org/films/april-and-the-extraordinary-world
results.name: ALLER AU CINÉMA--animation IN FRENCH!

Reservations are under last name Brugos.

- Watch the best locally-produced short films of all genres, and cast your ballot for the Audience Award.

 - TICKETS: $10 for auditorium, or $12 for seats in the table section (mezzanine) of the theater.


- Cocktail Hour: Meet & Greet Filmmakers and Directors, network with Pittsburgh cast, crew, directors, writers, fans, and all lovers of local film.

- $5 Indie Oaks Cocktail Specials concocted by The Oaks' master mixologist.

- Directors' Q& A hosted and recorded live by LoCast Media Network's Filmmaking Podcast.

For more information about the Indie Oaks Film Festival, please visit http://www.indieoaks.com/

For more information about the Oaks Theater, please visit http://theoakstheater.com/

New York based songstress Kosi rocks Pittsburgh with her fabulous jazz style with blues and rock influences. This girl can SING!! (Don't take my word for it--stream her for free on her website http://kosi-sings.com/)

Also, Pittsburgh's talented singer-songwriter Amy Mmhmm https://amymmhmm.bandcamp.com/ performs

Food available for purchase. Venue is Pittsburgh's only non-profit coffee shop.

group.name: The Pittsburgh Cultural Arts Meetup Group

results.description:
Celebrate International Jazz Day in the Cultural District and spend the night club hopping at the August Wilson Center. Imagine a legendary jazz club, a notorious dance hot spot, an intimate speakeasy and a cool out art lounge … all under one roof. Combine that with chef-inspired samplings and fine bourbon tastings, and you will have the time of your life, on the corner of RHYTHM AND GROOVE inside the beautiful August Wilson Center.

General admission and VIP tickets available (see below for details)

MUST BE 21+ YEARS OLD to attend. Valid ID required.

Please note that Rhythm & Groove supports the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust’s JazzLive programming. 

General Admission Ticket: $35 per person includes:

• Multiple live performances including Michael Mwenso & the Harlem Shakes featuring Brianna Thomas, Noel Quintana & the Latin Crew, Lyndsey Smith and the Soul Distribution, and DJ SMI spinning the turntables
• Sweet and savory bites from some of Pittsburgh’s best restaurants, including Braddock’s Pittsburgh Brasserie, The Capital Grille, Cioppino, Eddie Merlot’s, Revel + Roost, Savoy, Seviche, and Willow
• One drink ticket for a beverage of choice (wine, beer, specialty cocktail, bourbon tasting flights - cash bar following)
• A one-year Partners membership with the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust which includes many benefits such as a member discount on tickets to our summer event, Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh as well as invitations to cast parties, presale offers for upcoming shows (PNC Broadway touring shows, various concerts, and other productions), and discounts at Cultural District restaurants

$125 per person VIP experience includes all of the above, plus:

• Private VIP Lounge featuring:
   o Open bar with signature cocktails
   o Extraordinary appetizers
   o Bourbon tastings by RAISE YOUR SPIRITS
   o Exclusive live performance by The Balcony Legacy Big Band featuring Dwayne Dolphin
   o DJ Soy Sos spinning the turntables in between live performance sets
• Benefits during the Pittsburgh JazzLive International Festival in June that includes VIP seating for one

Offerings from participating restaurants include:

+ Revel + Roost - Short Ribs with bread and butter pickles, stone ground mustard and herb salad
+ Braddock’s Pittsburgh Brasserie - Drunken Duck Confit with Candied Onion Tart, Makers Mark and Cherry Gastrique, Ramp Aioli
+ The Capital Grille - Pecan Bourbon Cake
+ Cioppino - Pork Belly Sliders with Carolina BBQ Sauce
+ Eddie Merlot's - Grapefruit & Honey Ceviche, Shrimp, Mint, Basil & Pineapple
+ Savoy - Bistro Tenderloin Bites with a Chipotle Lime Sauce
+ Seviche - Sour Orange Braised Pork Shoulder with Chorizo Cornbread
+ Willow - Salted Caramel Panna Cotta; Peanut and Popcorn Crumble, Candied Bacon Tuile

For more info & TICKETS  Please go online https://trustarts.culturaldistrict.org/production/49381/rhythm-and-groove or call[masked], or visit the Theater Square Box Office. It only takes a couple minutes to submit the online form, and then you'll get a confirmation email regarding your tickets.  As a reminder, this 1-year Pittsburgh Cultural Trust membership is by household/address so this is important if you're thinking about this offer as a gift or bringing friends/family. Please contact Jenn at the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust if you have any questions for including the membership for others, such as if you could pay for this but give another address for the membership [masked]

For more information on the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust Partner program, please visit http://trustarts.org/support/Individual-Giving/partners-membership

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

For more info and tickets, please visit https://trustarts.culturaldistrict.org/production/49381/rhythm-and-groove

Stay tuned for updates!!

Saturday, April 30 8:00-11:00pm
August Wilson Center
MUST BE 21+ YEARS OLD to attend. Valid ID required.
results.how_to_find_us: Please meet in lobby about 7:30 PM (for introductions, drink, food, etc.) before the show begins at 8 PM

results.description:
We've got a great line-up of performers this year!
-Steve Pelegrino
-Jason Baldinger
-Vanessa Vesch & Neil Gerjouy
-Lrad
-Lori Jakiela
-Dylan Rooke & Red Coal Collective
-David Michael King
-Smokestack Lightning

The Pittsburgh General Membership Branch of the Industrial Workers of the World will be kicking off May Day celebrations and remembrances again this year on April 30. All members of the working class are invited to come join us at the Bulgarian Macedonian Cultural Center as we recognize the true Labor Day, May 1.

May Day, or International Workers’ Day, is a commemoration of the 1886 Haymarket affair in Chicago and the fight for the eight-hour work day.

Wobblies in Pittsburgh decided to mark the incredible historical significance of this day by having the Pittsburgh IWW chartered on May Day 2002.

There will be working class music, a cash bar, potluck food, and an IWW literature table. If possible, please bring food to share.

Pittsburgh IWW delegates will be in attendance to sign up all wage earners interested in becoming card-carrying members of the One Big Union. Delegates from the IWW General Defense Committee will be present to sign up members and answer questions as well.

This event will conclude with a march to the Homestead Strike Memorial just before midnight. Solidarity Forever!!!
results.name: BANDS: May Day Eve Commemoration! & POTLUCK!

group.name: Free and Almost Free in Pittsburgh

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
